RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET SYNTAX contested the pace through the backstretch, was forced to the five path on the turn but dug in determinedly to recover the nod under the wire. TRIPLE BAD chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail, dueled to a slim lead past the eighth pole and dug in gamely to the finish. BABY QUINN raced with the pace inside, drifted on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. DOC ELM gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. THUNDERINREADYRICK refused. The Stewards reviewed the start of this race before declaring it official.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SING A LULLABYE broke awkwardly then accelerated to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, was urged away at the rail on the turn and held well under a vigorous hand ride through the stretch. EMBERLY chased outside through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, cleared second nearing mid-stretch and finished well. I'M A TOTAL DIVA had a brief early lead then gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn, flattened stride past the eighth pole and just lasted for third. WISHING FOR SPRING gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path, drifted a bit entering the stretch and just missed third in an even finish. C TWO chased toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the stretch. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. MOIRAINE gave chase outside and rounded the turn in the six path.

ENTRY.NAME: Sing a Lullabye
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,up near 7/16,rated,urged away turn,held well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING OF LUCK chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in under determined handling to get the nod in the final yards. EVANESCO took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement through the lane but was outfinished in the final yards. ROAD PUNCH chased, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WINDSOR'S STAR pressured the pace to the head of the lane but dropped back past the eighth pole and flattened stride later yards. ROCKING TO HOME gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn about the five path, entered the lane just off the rail and flattened stride. BOP ZAPPER gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the lane. JUST JUBA angled to the outside and gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Punch
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Jay

ENTRY.NAME: Evanesco
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,dug in lane,outfinished final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considere d In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEY BOOTS took over while tapering in and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept sharp in the lane. POWERED BY LOVE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and finished well to close the gap. MON GATEAU chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. FROSTY THE GIANT gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and flattened in the lane. STREET TOUGH chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. GRUMPY BROOKSIE was never a factor. YEAH TAKE THAT dropped well back and raced outside.

ENTRY.NAME: Street Tough
ENTRY.OWNER: Gracie Mae Stables and Great Lake Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Yeah Take That
ENTRY.OWNER: Brooks Gerald E and Hess Jr Carl L

ENTRY.NAME: Hey Boots
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured near 1/4,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty the Giant
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: S S MIRAGE took the lead at the half mile pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the turn, lugged in under right hand urging mid-stretch and held on driving. RAISE A RUCKUS lunged leaving the gate then pressured the pace, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. ARYA CHARMING gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. CALLISTO'S BRIGADE chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, was shut off at the heels of S S Mirage mid-stretch and flattened stride. GETTIN SPICY gave chase, raced near the rail into the turn, angled out approaching the head of the lane and showed little more. METALLIC CAT chased, raced in the four path on the turn, was carried out toward the head of the lane and showed little in the stretch. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected, a claim of foul against the rider of S S Mirage for interference mid-stretch, lodged by the rider of Callisto's Brigade.

ENTRY.NAME: Metallic Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Purse 31300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NICO chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, angled to the five path approaching the head of the land, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew away later yards. JEFFERSON NATIVE set a pressured pace through the backstretch and contested the edge off the rail on the turn, relented the lead mid-stretch but held on for second. PENGUIN POWER chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, was carried out toward the head of the lane but finished evenly to take third later yards. LITTLE ROO ROO chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. GOLDEN KEY pressured the pace through the backstretch, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the turn then weakened toward mid-stretch. AMIDSHIPS gave chase then faded through the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Native
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge off rail turn,relented 1/16,held on 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 81. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE NOVEMBER 16, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BETCHA BY GOLLY took the lead while angling in and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and just lasted. DIVINE FASHION rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase passing the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, eased outward toward the head of the lane, dug in to take second inside the sixteenth pole and just missed in a strong finish. I HAVE COURAGE settled off the pace toward the inside, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and finished evenly to take third later yards. A LITTLE BIT CRAZY stalked off the rail the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and flattened nearing mid-stretch. UNCAPTURED RUBY rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, entered the far turn in the four path, left the turn outside and flattened in the lane. BONITA LASSIE saved ground. SECRET CASTLE rounded the opening turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened stride in the three path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured Ruby
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,4p far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: I Have Courage
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 7/16,rail far turn,even finish,up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: A Little Bit Crazy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Betcha by Golly
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,just lasted drvg

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEVIN ON EARTH closed to the lead nearing the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and held on under steady stretch handling. DAPHNE'S FIRE engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and finished well at the outside girth of the winner. TOUGH ENOUGH chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and dueled for third. GREAT DEVOTION gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. STORMY CUT gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened in the lane. CURLIN'S DOVE chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR was no factor racing outside. MIDNIGHT PASS gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path. MASHUA was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Devin On Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 1/2,set pressured pace,rail turn,held on driving
